titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the use of foreign law as authority in Federal courts.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 8/5/2011--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits U.S. courts, including the Supreme Court, from basing opinions or rulings on international laws, treaties, or religious laws. Makes any action of a court in violation of such prohibition null and void.
